SHIP BY GENERAL AIR EXPRESS
As an outgrowth of its pioneering activity in the air ship-
ping field. TWA has perfected a system for the fastest possible
method of shipping merchandise which is meeting with broad
public acceptance
Merchants, manufacturers, and shippers generally have
found air express offers a distinct advantage for making over-
night delivery of merchandise with no loss of business time be-
tween
New York, Chicago, St. Louis, Kansas City and other
midwest cities, also from coast to coast in twenty-three hours.
Through a new interline arrangement with six other air-
oints on the TWA system are now linked with 138
United States with connections to Canada, Mexico,
and South America. This new service known as General Air Ex-
"the interline system" permits the free exchange of mer-
and under standard shipping conditions. Through rates, including
store-door pickup and delivery service by Postal Telegraph are
published in a joint tariff which may be obtained from any
